Name: Kawamura
Why it is good: World's finest Kobe beef restaurant - Chef Kawamura personally selects each cut of A5 grade beef
Dietary notes: Limited vegetarian options - primarily beef focused
Tips: Reservations essential weeks in advance - budget ¥20000-30000+ per person

Name: Steak Misono
Why it is good: Birthplace of teppanyaki - authentic Kobe beef with historic atmosphere and show cooking
Dietary notes: Good seafood and vegetarian options available
Tips: Budget ¥8000-15000 per person - lunch sets offer better value than dinner

Name: Ganko Ramen
Why it is good: Authentic tonkotsu ramen with 12+ hour slow-cooked broth - perfect comfort food
Dietary notes: Some vegetarian broth options and chicken-based ramen available
Tips: Quick service perfect for conference breaks - order at vending machine with pictures

Name: Mouriya Honten
Why it is good: Historic steakhouse since 1885 - pioneers of Kobe beef with traditional atmosphere
Dietary notes: Excellent seafood options and vegetarian dishes available
Tips: Lunch sets excellent value ¥3000-8000 vs dinner ¥10000+ - try the sirloin

Name: Sake Bar Yamashina
Why it is good: Local Nada district sake with expert guidance - perfect for networking and cultural immersion
Dietary notes: Traditional izakaya dishes complement sake perfectly
Tips: Start early before 20:00 - let staff guide sake selection - pour for others not yourself

Name: Kobe Port Tower
Why it is good: Iconic red tower with 360-degree harbor views - perfect conference break spot
Dietary notes: Cafe and restaurant options available at base
Tips: Open 9:00-21:00 - ¥700 admission - less crowded in morning

Name: Meriken Park
Why it is good: Beautiful waterfront park perfect for morning jogs walking meetings and evening decompression
Tips: Free and open 24/7 - best times early morning or evening - can be windy near harbor

Name: Sannomiya District
Address: Sannomiya Station area, Chuo-ku, Kobe-shi, Hyogo
Why it is good: Main commercial hub with dining and shopping - highest concentration of restaurants and bars
Dietary notes: Every type of cuisine available from street food to fine dining
Tips: Get Port Liner day pass - peak dinner 19:00-21:00 so go earlier or later

Name: Kitano Foreign District
Why it is good: Historic Western-style houses from 1800s with stunning harbor views
Tips: Perfect afternoon conference break - comfortable shoes for hillside walking

Name: Starbucks Reserve Kobe
Why it is good: Premium Starbucks Reserve with coffee roasting theater and harbor views
Dietary notes: Premium pastries and light meals available
Tips: Peak times 11:00-14:00 - outdoor seating has best harbor views

Name: UCC Coffee Museum Cafe
Why it is good: Japanese coffee culture education with expert preparation and museum
Dietary notes: Light snacks and traditional Japanese coffee preparations
Tips: Quiet atmosphere perfect for calls - museum adds cultural value

Name: The Griffon British Pub
Why it is good: Authentic British pub with international expat community and real ales
Dietary notes: Traditional pub food - fish and chips bangers and mash
Tips: English-speaking environment - cash preferred - busy weekend evenings

Name: Ristorante Borgo Konishi
Why it is good: Authentic Northern Italian cuisine with Italian chef and imported ingredients
Dietary notes: Can accommodate dietary restrictions with advance notice
Tips: Reservations essential - lunch better value than dinner - excellent wine pairings

Name: Pizza da Granza
Why it is good: Authentic Neapolitan pizza with wood-fired oven and Naples-trained chef
Dietary notes: Vegetarian options available - can modify for dietary needs
Tips: Fast service perfect for conference groups - lunch rush 12:00-13:30
